data.title: Independence Bar
data.text:
Non-Alcoholic Beer

Athletic - Ripe Pursuit

$9

CT / <0.5% / 12oz Can / Non-alcoholic Radler. Lemon-infused, radler-style brew bursting with citrus and balanced with a light sweetness. Smooth and zesty with a moderate haze.

Featured Brewery

Timber Ales

Nomad brewery focusing on dark liquids. Beginning a homebrew operation in NYC and Long Island, currently brewing and operating out of Twelve Percent Beer Project’s facility in North Haven, CT.

Timber Ales - Sleepless Skylines

$14

CT / 6.5% / 16oz Can / The first NEIPA in the series is dry-hopped with Citra & Mosaic hops. The artwork depicts the Upper West Side skyline that sits above the Central Park Reservoir.

Timber Ales - Beer For Drinking At Dusk

$12

CT / 4.5% / 16oz Can / Roasty Dark Lager. Chocolately, with coffee notes, yet clean & balanced.

Timber Ales - Strawberry Brulée

$12

CT / 6% / 12oz Can / Snack Stout conditioned on maple syrup, coffee, and strawberries.

SEASONAL

Craft Cans & Bottles

Sixpoint - Dumbo Weisse

$12

NY / 5.7% / 16oz Can / Seasonal Hefeweizen. Fluffy wheat beer that's packed with notes of banana and clove.

Citizen Cider - Raspberry Crush

$12

VT / 4.6% / 16oz Can / Made with fresh raspberries, this Hard Cider is light, fresh, and juicy.

Limited Release

The Alchemist - Heady Topper

$13

VT / 8% / 16oz Can / For many this is the original unfiltered IPA. Brewed with a proprietary blend of six hops – each imparting its own unique flavor and aroma. You'll find tropical fruit, pink grapefruit, pine and spice. Enjoy this one from the can!

Greater Good - Pulp Daddy

$13

MA / 8% / 16oz Can / Juicy, hazy, citrus-forward NEIPA. Known as Nectar of the Hop Gods to some, this smooth-sipping beer packs the aroma of melon, mango, and papaya with the taste of fresh-squeezed orange juice.

Ommegang - Neon Gleam

$12

NY / 7.5% / 16oz Can / DDH Hazy IPA brewed with Sundew yeast, a Belgian Ale Yeast known for harmonizing fruity notes without eclipsing hop aroma and flavor. Featuring Citra, Nelson Sauvin, and Motueka. Collaboration with Other Half.

Rare Barrel - More Mango

$18

CA / 6.6% / 12oz Bottle / Golden sour beer aged in oak barrels with mangoes. From the legendary all-sour beer company located in Berkeley, CA.

Schenker - Cucumber Lime Glow Up

$10

CT / 4.5% / 12oz Can / Berliner Weisse Ale with cucumber & lime

Threes - Quintessence

$12

NY / 4.2% / 16oz Can / Pale Lager brewed with Magnolia Oolong, creating a delicate floral accent and array of subtle fruity and herbal undertones. Collaboration with Yesfolk, a family owned brewery making functional & fermented tonic beverages in Troy, NY.

New York Craft Beer Specials

OYSTER / STOUT SPECIAL

$14

A Pint of Wolfhound Oyster Stout & 3 Blue Point Oysters

WOLFHOUND BEER FLIGHT

$12

Enjoy a Beer Flight with a 5.5oz glass of Wolfhound Nitro Stout, Wolfhound Nitro Red, & Wolfhound Oyster Stout

Wolfhound - Oyster Stout on Happy Hour

$9

NY / 5% / 16oz / Roasted, dry and delicious, with the perfect amount of bitterness, and just a touch of salinity. Happy Hour, $7 (Monday - Friday, 4pm-7pm)

Seasonal

von Trapp - Radler

$9

VT / 3.9% / 14oz / Refreshing blend of a light lager with grapefruit juice. Perfect for summer sessions, outdoor activities, and enjoying the day. * Radler originated as a drink called Radlermass (cyclist liter) created by innkeeper Franz Kugler in the small town of Deisenhofen, outside Munich.

Ales

Samuel Fraunces Ale

$9

NY / 5% / 14oz / Amber Ale. Soft floral, fruit notes.

Wolfhound - Nitro Red

$9

NY / 4.2% / 16oz / Beautiful Nitro Irish Red Ale from Ireland's award-winning Porterhouse Brew Co. & New York's Flagship Brew Co. This creamy ale is fruity yet dry with the perfect amount of sweetness.

Stouts

Wolfhound - Nitro Stout

$9

NY / 4.2% / 16oz / Award-winning Porterhouse Brew Co., from Dublin, Ireland shared their “secret science” with Flagship Brew Co. to create this one of a kind Irish Dry Stout. Brewed in New York, with Irish innovation this crushable stout is perfectly balanced with smooth roasted flavors and just enough bitterness to keep you coming back for more.

Wolfhound - Oyster Stout

$9

NY / 5% / 16oz / Nitro Stout. Roasted, dry and delicious, with the perfect amount of bitterness, and just a touch of salinity.

Alesmith - Nitro Speedway

$10

CA / 12% / 8oz / Legendary Imperial Stout with coffee. Chocolate and roasted malts dominate the flavor, supported by notes of dark fruit, toffee, and caramel. A healthy dose of locally-roasted coffee added to each batch brings out the beer’s dark chocolate flavors and enhances its drinkability.

Southern Tier - Creme Brûlée

$10

NY / 10% / 8oz / Imperial Milk Stout. Rich and creamy vanilla custard swirls together with notes of sweet caramel, black malt, and milk sugar to create a deliciously balanced and smooth treat.

Lager

Torch & Crown - Tenement

$9

NY / 4.9% / 14oz / Refreshing Pilsner with a delicate dry hop bite.

Fifth Hammer - Pentatonic Pils

$9

NY / 4.8% / 14oz / German-style pilsner brewed with Pilsner malt, fermented with a traditional German Pilsner yeast and hopped with Saaz.

Sixpoint - BKLYN Sunny (Brooklyn Sunny)

$9

NY / 5% / 14oz / Citrus Lager with notes of lemon and lime.

DUBCO - Liquid Bread

$9

NY / 7.5% / 12oz / This Doppelbock Lager is brewed with rich deep malt character with sweet raisin and date notes. *Doppelbocks are a strong, rich and malty lager originally brewed by Bavarian monks in the 17th century. Designed to sustain the monks while they abstain from solid foods during the 40 day Lent period, doppelbocks earned the nickname ‘Liquid Bread’.

IPA / Pale Ale

Fat Orange Cat - Baby Kittens

$9

CT / 6.5% / 14oz / Hazy IPA with notes of fresh citrus, mangos, and pineapple. It finishes with a hint of pine and invigorating grapefruit.

Threes - Things We All Do

$9

NY / 6.8% / 14oz / Hazy IPA with Strata and Motueka full of fruity flavor, leaning into the tropical. Notes of lime colada and pink berry melon.

Evil Twin - Chopping Wood

$9

NY / 8.5% / 10oz / Double IPA brewed with raw wildflower honey and double dry-hopped with all Mosaic hops. Forward tasting notes of zesty orange, blueberry, evergreen, and bright accents of earthy honey. Medium bodied with a subtle bitterness. Collaboration with Trillium Brewing Company.

Saison / Farmhouse

Boulevard - Tank 7

$9

MO / 8.5% / 10oz / Legendary Belgian-style farmhouse ale takes off with a big surge of fruity aromatics and grapefruit-hoppy notes. The flavor of this complex, straw-colored ale tapers off to a peppery, dry finish.

Sour / Tart

Westbrook - Pineapple Gose

$9

SC / 4% / 10oz / Flavors of whipped pineapple, salt, and smooth vanilla.

Wheat Ale

Grimm - Weisse

$9

NY / 5.5% / 14oz / Bavarian-style hefeweissen with enticing notes of clove, lemon, and banana and is massively effervescent, soft, and pillowy.

Hard Cider & Mead

Hudson North - Strawberry Rhubarb

$9

NY / 5% / 12oz / Hazy & Dry Hard Cider. A refreshing summery twist on a strawberry rhubarb pie.

Crafted - Cherry CheeseQuaker

$10

OH / 6% / 10oz / Mead with notes of cream cheese (yes, cream cheese), cherry, vanilla and graham cracker crust.

By the bottle or can

Amber/Red Ale

Samuel Fraunces Ale

$9

NY / 5% / 12oz Can / Amber Ale. Soft floral, fruit notes | Also Available On Draft

Belgian-Style Ale

Allagash - Tripel

$12

ME / 9% / 12oz Bottle

Ommegang - Three Philosophers Quadrupel

$16

NY / 9.7% / 12oz Bottle / Rich and complex, this elegant blend of Belgian-style quadruple ale and authentic Belgian kriek has malty depth and gentle sweetness, enhanced by sparkling carbonation and a serendipitous touch of cherry.

Ommegang - Abbey Ale

$12

NY / 8.2% / 12oz Bottle / The brew that opened Ommegang’s doors back in 1997, Abbey Ale brought Trappist-style brewing to America. This full-bodied dubbel pours a deep burgundy with a fluffy head and enchanting aromas. Rich, fruity flavors and hints of honey, caramel and toffee linger before giving way to a long, dry finish. Brewed with Belgian specialty malts and a variety of spices

Black Lager

DUBCO - Blackwater Bay

$12

NY / 4.6% / 16oz Can / From Destination Unknown, this Black Lager with roasted malts gives off subtle flavors of coffee and chocolate. Light in body, but rich in flavor.

Brown Ale

Community Beer Works - The Whale

$11

NY / 5.9% / 16oz Can / Smooth, super drinkable Brown Ale layered with distinctive English malts and a touch of hops to create flavors and aromas of coffee, chocolate and toasted grains

Ginger Beer

Halyard - Extra Ginger

$10

VT / 6% 12oz Can / Hard Ginger Beer with extra ginger

Gluten Free

FDA Approved

Ghostfish - Grapefruit IPA

$10

WA / 5.5% / 12oz Can / American IPA brewed with grapefruit, makes this beer a juicy citrus bomb

Ghostfish - Meteor Lager

$10

WA / 4.5% / 12oz Can / Fermented cool with lager yeast to produce a smooth, mellow lager. Noble hop spice, with a clean, bready malt flavor.

Golden Ale

Edmund's Oast - A Light Touch (SOLD OUT)

$12

SC / 6% / 16oz Can / Belgian-inspired Golden Ale with notes of melon and honey.

Flagship - Bravest, Tunnel to Towers

$9

NY / 4.8% / 12oz Can / Easy-drinking Golden Ale brewed with Huell Melon and Cascade hops. *A portion of the proceeds will benefit the Tunnels To Towers Foundation - born out of 9/11, this charity benefits military and first responders.

Gose

German-style Sour Ale, brewed with sea salt.

Westbrook - Gose

$10

SC / 4% / 12oz Can / Westbrook's take on the traditional German-style sour wheat beer helped to popularize the style in the US. Brewed with coriander and grey sea salt, this beer is sour, salty, & delicious.

IPA / Pale

Sixpoint - Sweet Action

$9

NY / 5% / 12oz Can / Hybrid Pale Ale featuring elements of blonde ale and wheat beer.

SingleCut - 18 Watt

$10

NY / 5% / 12oz Can / Session IPA. with big flavor notes of orange zest, tangerine, and tropical juice.

Kölsch

Ale-Lager Hybrid

EBBS - Kölsch

$9

NY / 4.5% / 12oz Can / Aromas of fresh bread dough, subtle apple and Honey Teddy Grahams. The first sip reveals spicy & floral notes supporting a backbone of steel cut oats with a drizzle of honey. Light and dry on the palate. Clean yet fruity & crisp.

Light Lager

Hoboken - Day Beer

$10

NJ / 4.2% / 12oz Can / 99 calories

Lager

Abita - Amber

$9

LA / 4.5% / 12oz Can / New Orleans favorite beer this Amber Lager is brewed with pale and caramel malts and German Perle hops, it has a smooth, malty, slightly caramel flavor.

Sixpoint - Alpenflo

$12

NY / 4.9% / 16oz Can / Helles Lager brewed with Tettnanger hops directly from family farms in Bavaria to give it that gentle spice.

Zero Gravity - Green State Lager

$10

VT / 4.9% / 12oz Can / A crisp, easy drinking lager. Noble hops in perfect balance with only the finest Pilsner malt provide a clean and satisfying brew.

Saison / Farmhouse

Blackberry Farms - Classic

$10

TX / 6.3% / 12oz Can / Medium bodied Saison pours with a voluminous head and releases bright notes of lemon and a crisp, spicy hop aroma. Finishes clean and dry.

Oxbow - Whole Leaf

$11

ME / 5.5% / 12oz Can / Saison brewed with whole leaf European hops. Beautiful mix of earthy, light citrus, and subtle farmhouse phenolics. Light and refreshing.

Sour / Tart / Wild

Central Waters - Iconic

$10

WI / 6.5% / 12oz Can / Fruited Sour Ale reminiscent of a cherry limeade slush.

Crooked Stave - Sour Rosé

$10

CO / 4.5% / 12oz Can / Wild Ale fermented in oak, with raspberries and blueberries.

Firestone - Primal Elements

$18

CA / 6% / 16oz Can / This rare American Fruited Sour Ale loaded with huge fresh flavors of Mango, Pineapple & Tangerine. Ripened in oak barrels this beer is soft, juicy and refreshing, showcasing bold aromas and flavors.

Rare Barrel - More Mango

$18

CA / 6.6% / 12oz Bottle / Golden sour beer aged in oak barrels with mangoes. From the legendary all-sour beer company located in Berkeley, CA.

Schenker - Cucumber Lime Glow Up

$10

CT / 4.5% / 12oz Can / Berliner Weisse Ale with cucumber & lime

Urban Artifact - Gadget

$11

OH / 8% / 12oz Can / "Midwest Fruit Tart" with blackberries, raspberries, and a touch of vanilla bean.

Stouts & Porter

Central Water - Brewer's Reserve Bourbon Barrel Stout

$18

WI / 10.8% / 12oz Bottle / The brewery's most highly sought after beer, this Imperial Stout is aged to perfection in 12 year bourbon barrels. Look for this tasty teat to contain hints of bourbon and vanilla with roasted overtones.

Evil Twin - Even More Irish Jesus

$14

NY / 4.7% / 16oz Can / Irish Dry Stout with a robust flavor that pays homage to Ireland's rich brewing tradition.

Finback - Blueberry Drip

$14

NY / 11.5% / 16oz Can / Imperial Coffee Stout with blueberry, vanilla, peanut butter, & coffee.

Grimm - Single Negative

$14

NY / 5.5% / 16oz Can / Small-batch Stout delivers robust roast character in a crushable, medium-bodied format. Made using the final runnings of the legendary Double Negative.

Prairie - This is the Way

$32

OK / 13.6% / 12oz Bottle / Barrel Aged Imperial Stout with dark chocolate creme filled cookies, toasted coconut, toasted marshmallow flavor & toasted almonds. This is the Way.

Timber - Strawberry Brulée

$12

NY / 6% / 12oz Can / Snack Stout conditioned on maple syrup, coffee, and strawberries.

Wayward Lane - Portmanteau (SOLD OUT)

$12

NY / 6% / 16oz Can / London Style Brown Porter. Somewhere between a Brown Ale & a Porter this beer has caramel and chocolate notes.

Wheat Beer

Allagash - White

$10

ME / 5.2% / 12oz Bottle / Belgian-style Wit

Sixpoint - Dumbo Weisse

$12

NY / 5.7% / 16oz Can / Fluffy Hefeweizen beer that's packed with notes of banana and clove.

Ever Grain - Fluffhead

$11

PA / 5% / 16oz Can / Bavarian style Hefeweizen with notes of ripe banana and clove.

Hard Cider

By the bottle or can

Hudson North - Citrus Ginger

$10

NY / 5% / 12oz Can / Dry & Hazy Hard Cider bursting with notes of freshly squeezed grapefruit and orange citrus with hints of sweet lemony ginger.

Hudson North - Standard

$10

NY / 5% / 12oz Can / Crisp, full-bodied Hard Cider. Hazy & dry.

Wölffer - Dry Rosé Cider

$12

NY / 6.9% / 12oz Bottle / Sparkling dry cider.

Mead

By the bottle or can

Heeman's - Cherry Grove

$12

ON / 6.9% / 12oz Can / The magic of cherry blossom honey melds with the luscious taste of ripe cherries.

Hard Kombucha

Juneshine - P.O.G.

$10

CA / 6% / 12oz Can / Hard Kombucha with a fresh twist on an island staple - featuring real passion fruit, orange and guava.

From the Cellar

At Fraunces Tavern®

Allagash - Coolship Resurgam

$36

ME / 6.3% / 12.7oz / A blend of both old and young un-fruited spontaneous beer. The finished beer has aromas of apricot and lemon zest. Notes of tropical fruit and light funk lead to a clean, tart, and dry finish. The name comes from the motto of our fair city, Portland, Me. It means “I shall rise again”. Coolship Resurgam won a Silver medal at the 2010 GABF.

The Bruery - Black Tuesday

$100

CA / 19.5% / 25oz Bottle / One of the most coveted beers in the world, this Bourbon Barrel-Aged Imperial Stout is a beer you won’t soon forget. Elegant, innovative, complex: Black Tuesday provides a uniquely elevated beer-drinking experience unlike any other. Rich, complex flavor from time spent aging in bourbon barrels mingles effortlessly with distinct notes of crème brûlée, poached figs, and milk chocolate. Surprisingly smooth.

Cantillon - Sang Bleu, 2023 (SOLD OUT)

$78

Belgium / 6.5% / 25oz Bottle / Lambic blend with blue honeysuckle berries. These berries are slightly sweet with a beautiful acidity.

Central Waters - Call Me Old Fashioned, 2022

$21

WI / 12% / 12oz Bottle / Imperial Red Ale brewed with cherries, a touch of bitters, and then aged in Brandy, Bourbon, and Orange Curaçao barrels. Central Waters' take on an Wisconsin Old Fashioned.

FiftyFifty - Eclipse: Old Trestle Bourbon Barrel, 2022 Vintage

$58

CA / 11.4% / 16.9oz / Imperial Stout aged 6 months in Old Trestle bourbon barrels. Big barrel presence, warming, viscous, and fudgy. Hints of dark chocolate, espresso, and a smooth complexity

Fifth Hammer - Kriek

$32

NY / 5.5% / 16.9oz / Inspired by classic Belgian beer, Fifth Hammer Kriek started out in a mixed culture oak solera tank where the base beer has been aging for well over a year. The beer, containing over 12 different strains of brettonomyces, was then set down on tart red cherries for a period to capture all the sweet and tart notes of the fruit and to obtain its beautiful red tone. Finally bottle conditioned in January of 2023 with additional tart cherry juice it was laid to rest until mature. The final product is bold and complex with funk from the solara cultures melding with the sweet and tart fruit of the cherries. Long, dry and deep.

Firestone Walker - 25, 2021 Vintage

$32

CA / 11.5% / 12.7oz Bottle / 25th Anniversary Ale. A blend of Parabola Autumn Edition, Tequila Barrel Merkin, Brandy Barrel Barley Wine, Stickee Monkee, and Whiskey Barrel Wheat Wine

Firestone Walker - Mezca-Limón, 2021

$30

CA / 13.5% / 12.7oz / Echoing the traditional Mezcalita recipe, this specialty base beer was brewed with agave, chile peppers, sea salt, and aged in mezcal and orange bitters barrels, all finished with a touch of lime zest

Firestone Walker - Tequila Barrel Sunrise, 2021 Vintage

$30

CA / 11% / 12.7oz / Helldorado, Blonde Barleywine, aged in Extra Ańejo tequila barrels, and then blended with small lots of cherry and orange bitters barrels. Finished off with an infusion of orange zest and hibiscus, creating a beer where deep, wood-aged spirits meet flavors of grenadine and classic bitters

Prairie - This is the Way

$32

OK / 13.6% / 12oz Bottle / Barrel Aged Imperial Stout with dark chocolate creme filled cookies, toasted coconut, toasted marshmallow flavor & toasted almonds. This is the Way.

Wild East - Cosplay: Peach

NY / 6.3% / 16.9oz / Barrel-aged mixed fermentation Saison conditioned on second-use peaches for a delicate, nuanced stone fruit flavor. Tart with moderate acidity, light peachy funk, oaky notes, light tannins and a semi-dry, semi-juicy finish

Extra Rare Whiskey

Midleton, Dair Ghaelach - Kylebeg Wood

$98

56% ABV, specially selected range of 15 to 28 year-old Single Pot Still whiskeys, finished in casks made from virgin Irish oak grown in Kylebeg Wood in Co. Laois. (Dair Ghaelach means quite simply, Irish Oak)

Glenmorangie, Grand Vintage 1989

$240

43% ABV, the second release in the Vintage Collection is aged in ex-bourbon, ex-oloroso sherry and ex-Côte Rôtie casks. This is a complex and many-faceted dram crafted by the warehouse team, as they shepherded it along through almost three decades of maturation. The result brings together the distillery's classic orangey citrus character with toffee, honey and spice, as well as a whiff of barrel-char wood smoke.

Orphan Barrel, Muckety-Muck 25 Year Old

$64

46.5% ABV, The Orphan Barrel series highlights limited quantities of very old whiskeys heroically rescued from the mouldering corners of various warehouses. This Single Grain whisky is from the former Port Dundas Distillery, in Glasgow. The aroma starts with a burst of caramel and notes of baked sugar backed by the taste of crisp fruit and light toasted oak. The fruit forward flavor is blended with hints of butterscotch vanilla which carry through to the finish.

Midleton Very Rare, 2022

$108

40% / This hand-crafted and masterfully-selected blend of Irish whiskeys aged between 12 and 33 years in ex-bourbon casks is an exceptional spirit, one of the most exclusive and flavor-packed ones on the market.

Midleton Very Rare, 2023

$98

40% / Master Distiller, Kevin O’Gorman crafted a balanced blend of rare and hand-selected single pot still and single grain Irish whiskeys from Midleton’s exclusive inventory to create this truly special release.
